location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Sketch Map of the Perso-Turkish Frontier

physicalDescription.extent: Materials:Ink on tracing paper.Dimensions:240 x 190 mm.

mods.abstract: Map indicating the present and proposed frontier line (drawn as dot-dashed and dashed lines respectively) between Turkey and Persia [Iran], south of Mount Ararat. Also indicated on the map are: Mount Ararat, Lesser Ararat, the towns of Bayazid [Doğubayazıt] in Turkey, and Mākū and Kelissa Kendi [Kalīsā Kandī] in Persia.Reference to the map is made in a note preceding the map in the file, entitled ‘Information obtained from Major Nishet, Turkish Military Attaché’, prepared by the Military Attaché at the British Legation in Tehran in October 1931 (ff 88-89).
